relation: With deepest sympathy, Rich & Lydia Simonetti
Our deepest sympathy and our prayers for you all on the loss of Cameron.
I am very sorry for your loss. You all will be in my thoughts and prayers.
We are very saddened by your loss. We will continue to keep you all in our thoughts and prayers. May God bless and comfort your family during this difficult time. Larry & Kathy.
Our sincere condolences to you and your entire family during this difficult time... You are in our prayers. Chuck and Sue
We send our most heartfelt sympathy and prayers to Ric and your family during this very difficult time. God bless
We love you guys. Our thoughts and prayers are with you! Love - Jessie, Matt and Ellie
King Solomon said, "Trust in The Lord with all your heart, and lean not on your own understanding; in all your ways acknowledge Him, and He shall direct your paths" (Prov. 3:5-6)
Our thoughts and prayers go out to Ric, Georgia and the entire Collins Family.
Rest in Peace Cameron. We will all miss you.
Our hearts go out to Ric, Georgia, Morgan, and Oliva.
Cameron was a wonderful soul. He will be greatly missed.

As with Cameron's immediate family, members of his extended family also so hoped more research had been done and that there were more resources available to help him with this horrible and as yet non-cureable disease.
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {2269=We are very saddened by your loss. We will continue to keep you all in our thoughts and prayers. May God bless and comfort your family during this difficult time. Larry & Kathy.}
textBeforeTable: Given in memory of Cameron Collins This page was created by Morgan Collins in memory of Cameron Collins $1,635.00 raised: $100.00 target: Cameron Collins We love you. Thank you for your support. We appreciate everything you've said and done for us during this trying time. Because of this, we have requested that during this trying time, in lieu of flowers, that donations be made here, to NAMI. We don't know if a better mental health care system would have saved our son/brother, but it might help someone else. This is a very personal issue for us, but one which we now understand, through this process, affects so many individuals and families; there are no words for the frustration we all feel when trying to get help for a loved one with a mental illness. Our family has created this donation page in honor of our son and brother, Cameron Collins. As some of you may know,
